required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of AND017 to Treat Anemia in Non-dialysis-Dependent Chronic Kidney Disease (NDD-CKD) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Phase II Multicenter, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging, Safety and Efficacy Study of Oral AND017 to Treat Anemia in Nondialysis-Dependent Chronic Kidney Disease (NDD-CKD) Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot phase II study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of AND017 in NDD-CKD patients

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pilot phase 2, multicenter, randomized, parallel-group, double-blind, placebo-controlled, dose-ranging, safety and efficacy study of oral AND017 to treat anemia in non-dialysis-dependent chronic kidney disease patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of rise in hemoglobin for each of 3 dose levels as compared with placebo from baseline to 5 weeks after TIW oral dosing
primary_outcome.description: Calculate the slope of a linear regression for each patient using all hemoglobin data collected during the Fixed-Dose Period

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb response to treatment during Period 1
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative percentage of patients with Hb ≥10.0 g/dL
Responder is defined as a hemoglobin ≥10.0 g/dL and an increase in hemoglobin by ≥1.0 g/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of visits at which patients maintain hemoglobin between 10.0-11.0 g/dL after achieving hemoglobin ≥10.0 g/dL
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of visits at which patients maintain hemoglobin between 10.0-11.0 g/dL after achieving hemoglobin ≥10.0 g/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hemoglobin levels from baseline to the mean of weeks 10-13
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hemoglobin levels from baseline to the mean of weeks 10-13

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who maintain hemoglobin between 10.0-11.0g/dL at each visit
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who maintain hemoglobin between 10.0-11.0g/dL at each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Hb levels at weeks 6-14 including the average of weeks 10-13
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Hb levels at weeks 6-14 including the average of weeks 10-13

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of lack of response over the entire treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Hb level < 10.0 g/dL and an increase in hemoglobin from baseline of < 1 g/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess changes in the levels of PD indicator - EPO
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in the levels of EPO

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess changes in the levels of PD indicator - hepcidin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess changes in the levels of hepcidin

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess iron utilization parameter during treatment - transferrin level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 3, 6, 9, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess transferrin level during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess iron utilization parameter during treatment - total iron-binding capacity (TIBC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 3, 6, 9, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess TIBC level during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess iron utilization parameter during treatment - transferrin saturation (TSAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 3, 6, 9, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess TSAT level during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess iron utilization parameters during treatment - ferritin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 3, 6, 9, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess ferritin level during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess iron utilization parameters during treatment - serum iron
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at Week 3, 6, 9, 12, 14, and 28 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess serum iron level during treatment

arm_group.description: AND017 will be administrated orally at dose A
AND017 will be administrated orally at dose B
AND017 will be administrated orally at dose C

intervention.description: Orally, 3 times per week in Period 1 and randomize to TIW or QW group at the same dose in Period 2

criteria.textblock:
Important Inclusion Criteria:
1. Non-dialysis-dependent renal anemia patients who are naïve to ESA and prolyl-hydroxylase inhibitors.
2. Baseline Hb level ≥ 8 g/dL and <10.0 g/dL.
3. No iron deficiency and no other cause for anemia other than CKD.
4. TSAT ≥ 20% and ferritin ≥ 100 ng/mL at screening test
5. Serum folate and vitamin B12 ≥ lower limit of normal at screening test
Important Exclusion Criteria:
1. Concurrent retinal neovascular lesions requiring treatment including proliferative diabetic retinopathy, exudative age-related macular degeneration, retinal vein occlusion, macular edema, etc.
2. Concurrent autoimmune disease with inflammatory symptoms that is possibly the principal cause of anemia.
3. History of gastric/intestinal resection considered influential on the absorption of drugs in the gastrointestinal tract or concurrent gastroparesis.
4. Clinically significant bleeding (eg, requiring transfusion or drop in Hb of ≥ 2g/dL) within 4 weeks of first dose; no bleeding diathesis or risk of bleeding that has not been medically or surgically corrected at least 4 weeks prior to first dose of study drug.
5. Uncontrolled hypertension (more than one-third of identifiable diastolic blood pressure values >90 mmHg within 16 weeks prior to and including the screening assessment).
6. Concurrent congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association [NYHA] Class III or higher).
7. History of stroke, transient ischemic attack, myocardial infarction, thromboembolic event, pulmonary embolism, or lung infarction within 24 weeks before the screening assessment.
8. Concurrent anemia due to another cause other than renal anemia
9. Known hemosiderosis, hemochromatosis or hyper-coagulable condition
10. Patients that have major surgery planned during the study period.
11. Having undergone blood transfusion and/or a surgical procedure within 8 weeks before the screening assessment.
12. Having undergone a kidney transplantation.
13. History of a seizure disorder or any occurrence of seizures in the past
